text:
Mr. [**Known lastname **] is a 81 yo [**Country 4486**] speaking only man.  He has a recent
   diagnosis of HIV ([**7-31**]), has C.diff with leukocytosis in 40s, adrenal
   insufficiency, MDS(prbc and plt transfusion dependent), worsening
   acidosis and renal failure due to ATN.  He also has L leg pain and
   erythema. Admit to the MICU for hypotension and lactate 5.
   Acute Pain
   Assessment:
   Pt with pain to his lt leg when touched.Has got patches of erythmatous
   areas on his lt leg and both groin.
   Action:
   Medicated with morphine x1.Had usg to his Lt leg.
   Response:
   USG showed clots to superficial Fem vein and poplitial.Plan was to
   start heparin but pt was guiac pos,Transfused 2 units PRBC.Post
   transfusion hct 28.8.
   Plan:
   Team to decide plan for heparin gtt.
   Impaired Skin Integrity
   Assessment:
   +anasarca, oozing for sites on Left upper extreme, groin with
   yeast,blisters to back and looks more red and blanching.Pt has got
   small skin breakdown to his coccyx.
   Action:
    Frequent change of position,softsorb insitu.
   Response:
   Plan:
   Follow skin exam,?appreciate skin care consult.
   Renal failure, acute (Acute renal failure, ARF)
   Assessment:
   Bun 81, cr 2.7, K5.4, urine output 5-10cc dark amber concentrated,
   extensive anasarca
   Action:
   Monitoring lytes, urine output, consult renal
   Response:
   Worsening renal failure
   Plan:
   Follow labs, weight, I/O, renal recs
   Sepsis, Severe (with organ dysfunction)
   Assessment:
   Temp 95-96, WCC trending down,
   Action:
   Warming measures as pt tolerates, follow wbc, administer iv abx
   Response:
   Temp 95-96 range , bair hugger on, WBC trending down.
   Plan:
   Follow fever curve, follow wbc, collect stool specimens, f/u ct results
